subject: Re: [junit] Question about how to test data
msgSnippet: Hi Mike, ... Would it make sense to have an automated test compare the rows in the Excel sheet to the rows in the database table? Lasse -- Lasse Koskela *
messageBody:
Hi Mike,

On Dec 12, 2007 10:47 PM, Mike Foley <mike_foley_01612@...> wrote:
> I guess my problem statement is this: the business analysts have an
> Excel spreadsheet with hundreds of rows...each row defines some unique
> requirement on the way this particular thing is supposed to work. Each
> row in this spreadsheet, each requirement if you will, is not
> implemented in code.....but in data...which I am calling reference data
> or meta data....in this table.

Would it make sense to have an automated test compare the rows in the
Excel sheet to the rows in the database table?

Lasse

--
Lasse Koskela
* Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *
* Reaktor Innovations * http://www.ri.fi/en *
